basics.name: Pietro Pezzullo
basics.label: Fullstack & Web3 Developer
basics.summary: Fullstack developer with hands-on experience in both Web3 and traditional Web2 environments. I’ve participated in multiple blockchain hackathons, including ETHRome and ETHGlobal, where I built and deployed decentralized applications. Through my professional experience, I’ve gained a solid understanding of classical backend development, as well as frontend technologies like React, Tailwind, and server actions. I bring a well-rounded technical skill set and adaptability across modern development stacks.

education.summary: Software development in UNIX/LINUX, GitHub and Co-Working, Scripting in bash, C, C++, Docker, Threads, Data structures and algorithms, OOP, Networking basics, HTTP protocol, VM's, Fullstack development
Law, Political Economy, Business Economics, English, Computer Science, History, Italian

work.name: Origins Solution
work.summary: As a Junior Fullstack Developer at Origin Solutions, I have worked on both internal tools and client-commissioned applications, contributing across the entire development stack. My role involves building and maintaining frontend interfaces and backend services, ensuring seamless integration, performance, and usability in real-world environments.
highlights: Developed and maintained fullstack applications using modern frameworks and tools.
Collaborated on both internal products and external client solutions, adapting to diverse requirements and use cases.
Built and improved backend APIs while integrating them with responsive, user-facing frontend components.
Contributed to code reviews, bug fixes, and performance optimizations across the stack.
Participated in the planning and execution of feature implementations in production-ready environments.

work.summary: Tokenized is a Bitcoin wallet for issuing, managing and trading digital tokens. I built out the front end which was packaged as an electron app. It was a difficult frontend to build because we store the users keys locally and used them to sign transactions and contracts.
work.name: Tokenized
highlights: React
Redux
SCSS
Product

work.summary: Blockbid is an Australian crypto currency exchange. I started off on the frontend but eventually became lead tech and worked on every moving piece of the exchange. I really enjoyed working with liquidity providers and connecting their platforms to help us achieve liquid markets.
work.name: Blockbid
highlights: React, Apollo, Styled Components
Node.js / Rails
Docker / Heroku / GCP
Used Figma for design and UX work
Optimizing markets with tens of millions of rows using SQL.
Worked with Postgres, Redis and Dynamodb for storage.
Hosted on a mixture of Heroku Apps and EC2 servers.
Caching by Fastly and Cloudflare
Hybrid app supported on all platforms
work.summary: Built a very large and complex React / Redux application. It works on all platforms and has IOS/Android builds due to it being a PWA. (wrapped it in React Native though only implementing a WebView)
work.name: Listium

highlights: Millions of sites use the CDN in production
Larger market share than Yahoo's, Microsoft's and Google's javascript content distribution networks
We serve hundreds of billions request a month
Contains over 3000 popular Javascript libraries
Millions of developers visit the site per year
work.summary: Following Google's CDN for jQuery, we decided to start a CDN for the less popular Javascript frameworks. The CDN is community moderated and open source on GitHub. We secured a partnership with Cloudflare who now supports the infrastructure.
work.name: Cdnjs

highlights: Developed new tools for contacting congress
Brainstormed campaign ideas to raise maximum awareness about issues
Lots of social networking integration
work.summary: Hired to take EFF's campaigning to the next level by building an action centre in Ruby on Rails. The action centre is built around some large open source tools that lower the barrier to entry when contacting congress.
work.name: Electronic Frontier Foundation

highlights: Managed a small team of developers and designers
Built the entire frontend application with Backbone.js
Transferred all of the infrastructure from Heroku to AWS
work.summary: Started off as a front end developer but took on the role of CTO in early 2013. The application frontend is built with Javascript and organized as a single page application that talks to a collection of Rails web servers which are connected to MongoDB.
work.name: Earbits

highlights: This resume is built with JSON Resume
Over 3000 stars on Github
Community developed themes
Tens of thousands of users
work.summary: JSON Resume is a community driven open source initiative to create a JSON based standard for resumes. There is no reason why there can't be a common standard for writing a resume that can be extended with an ecosystem of open source tools.
work.name: JSON Resume

highlights: Generated  37,000,000 banner views
100, 000 phone calls to congress
500, 000 emails
250, 000 signatures
work.summary: Worked on many politically charged campaigns against mass surveillance. Not only technically challenging work but also a lot of networking and getting my hands dirty with politics.    Our biggest project was "TheDayWeFightBack"..
work.name: Taskforce.is

highlights: The site and blog combined have managed to receive over 200,000 visitors in 2014.
work.summary: An international directory of civilian drone / UAV operators for hire. Services include aerial photography, aerial video, mapping, surveying, precision agriculture, real estate photography, remote inspections and infrared imaging. Our plan is to be the place to go when looking for UAV/Drone services. The website is built in Backbone.js and API is built with Node.js and Postgres.
work.name: Drone Hire

highlights: Over two million unique visitors a year
25,000+ ebook downloads
300,000+ Youtube views
work.summary: I write tutorials and blog post regarding the popular Javascript framework Backbone.js. The tutorials cover a range of topics regarding front end development aimed at beginners, experts and anyone in between.
work.name: BackboneTutorials.com

work.summary: Ephox is a worldwide company who is heavily involved with the development of TinyMce and enterprise editors. My primary role included building front-end widgets and applications. Worked on a major product using Backbone.js as a base. Heavily involved in UI/UX design and wire-framing. Also spend a lot of time designing API specifications and documentation.
work.name: Ephox

projects.name: Urbe Campus Hackathon Winner Project
projects.summary: Led backend development for 42Care, a decentralized fundraising app. Collaborated with a cross-functional team to connect the backend and frontend in Next.js. Put Web3 skills to the test and won the hackathon.
highlights: Fullstack Web3 development
Smart contract integration
Next.js frontend integration
